io.atomix.variables

Class DistributedLong

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.resource.AbstractResource<T>
      • io.atomix.variables.AbstractDistributedValue<DistributedLong,Long>
        • io.atomix.variables.DistributedLong
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Managed<DistributedLong>, Resource<DistributedLong>

    public class DistributedLong
extends AbstractDistributedValue<DistributedLong,Long>
    Stores a replicated 64-bit number, supporting atomic increments, decrements, and compare-and-set.

    The DistributedLong resource is modeled on Java's AtomicLong, providing asynchronous versions of all the methods present in that class. Users can use DistributedLong to generate unique IDs or monotonically increasing tokens or as a counter. State change operations are linearizable and are therefore guaranteed to take place some time between the invocation of a state change method and the completion of the returned CompletableFuture. 

       
   DistributedLong value = atomix.getLong("foo").get();
   value.set(1).join();
   value.incrementAndGet(value -> {
     ...
   });

    Implementation

    State management for the DistributedLong resource is implemented as a snapshottable Copycat StateMachine. Changes to the long value are written to a log and replicated to a majority of the cluster before being applied to the state machine. State changes are applied to the state machine atomically, and the value is stored in a single 64-bit field. Periodically, a 64-bit snapshot of the resource's state is written to disk, and prior increment and decrement operations are removed from the replicated log during compaction.
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • addAndGet

        public CompletableFuture<Long> addAndGet(long delta)
        Adds a delta to the long and returns the updated value.

        This is an atomic operation that is guaranteed to take place exactly once between the invocation of the method call and the completion of the returned CompletableFuture. Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed, all other instances of the resource can see the state change when writing or reading using atomic consistency.

        If the operation is successful, the returned future will be completed with the updated value.

        Parameters:
        delta - The delta to add.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the result.

      • getAndAdd

        public CompletableFuture<Long> getAndAdd(long delta)
        Adds a delta to the value and returns the previous value.

        This is an atomic operation that is guaranteed to take place exactly once between the invocation of the method call and the completion of the returned CompletableFuture. Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed, all other instances of the resource can see the state change when writing or reading using atomic consistency.

        If the operation is successful, the returned future will be completed with value prior to the update.

        Parameters:
        delta - The delta to add.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the result.
